data.text: This section contains all aspects about Generator Interface, divided in base at config.yml file
How you want open interface? You can configure it in <font style="color: rgb(255, 19, 0);">InterfaceOpen </font>options

items.content: Shift + Right Click: in this case for open the interface you have to crouch and right click on the frame of generator;
Shift + Left Click: in this case for open the interface you have to crouch and left click on the frame of generator;
Shift + "": in this case for open the interface you have to crouch and right click or left click on the frame of generator;
Right Click: in this case for open the interface you have to right click on the frame of generator;
Left Click: in this case for open the interface you have to left click on the frame of generator;
Undefined: in this case for open the interface you have to right click or left click on the frame of generator;

data.message: You want an empty hand when open the interface? You can configure it in <font style="color: rgb(255, 19, 0);">EmptyHand </font>option.
P.S. Pay attention at this configurations!

data.text: If you have this example of settings:
If you click with the pickaxe or the sword with left click (as you would do for mining or killing) the plugin open the interface of the generator.
You want the items of generator is only for sell purpose? You can configure it in <font style="color: rgb(255, 19, 0);">InterfaceItemTake</font> option:

items.content: If you enable it is possible get the items in the generator interface;
If you disable it is not possible get the items in the generator interface;

data.text: You want limited item for slot in the generator? You can configure it in <font style="color: rgb(255, 19, 0);">MaxItemForSlot </font>option:

items.content: If you use -1 you have infinite items for each slot;
If you use any other number you have a limit defined from the number you writed;

data.text: "Unlimited" is the text dispalyed in the informations of Generator Interface, you can write what you want but if you don't have idea there are some here:

items.content: "Unlimited": write this if you use -1 for declaring infinite items such as: '-1:Unlimited';
A number: write the same number you chose as the limit such as: '64:64';
"?": if you don't want inform the player use it on how much is the limit, such as: '64:?';

data.text: In this case the limit is only your immagination :D
You want a limited number of slots usable in the generator? you can configure it in <font style="color: rgb(255, 19, 0);">InterfaceSlots.Enabled</font> option:

items.content: If you enable it you permit at all generators to have a number of limited slots configurable in InterfaceSlots.Default section;
If you disable it all the slots are unlocked, in this case the max number of slots is detected in the Interfaces section of config;

data.text: If you want upgrade the size of generator when reach the max level you can configure it in UpgradeSize section. This is a particular feature only for a Normal Generator (for more informations about the Normal Generator see the section Generators). When the player reach the last upgradable level if this feature is enable when upgrade the generator is deleted and the plugin give at the player a new generator of level 1 of the next size. Is possible also configure what is the next generator in the Generators section, and is possible configure the levels in generators.yml file
If you create a lot of levels and you want buy more levels insted one at time is possibile enable the FastUpgrade section. Also this feature is avaiable only for a Normal Generator.
In the <font style="color: rgb(255, 19, 0);">ItemCollecting </font>section is possible configure where you want the items:

items.content: Interface: this is the default configuration and all the above configurations regards this type of collecting;
Inventory: directly in the inventory of player;
Ground: dropped such as in Vanilla;

data.message:
P.S. There is another possibility for collecting items, directly in a 
chest! But for use this type the configuration correct for this section 
is "Interface". If you want see the configuration for this take a look 
at <font style="color: rgb(255, 19, 0);">Configuration.ChestItem</font> config section and at <font style="color: rgb(255, 19, 0);">AutoFil </font>section in base at your type of generator!
